Comments_List: 8-10 (practicum hours)
I spent a total of 102 hours on this course between January 14th - April 26th including on and off-site work.
5-10 hrs/week
Met the 100hr work requirement
It was good, a practicum is required and I had an interesting project so that was positive
Great experience!
practical, exposes you to real-life scenarios
I think it was well designed and executed. Elaine and Diane were excellent.

I felt that this course was very beneficial to me as it provided me the opportunity to experience work at the state Department of Public Health. My practicum supervisor at the department was extremely helpful, welcoming, and supportive. I did find the commuting slightly time consuming especially with a number of other courses that I had to attend, however I felt that it was worth it for me to gain experience in an area that is actually of interest to me. 

I felt that some of the work required by the actual practicum class at the end of the project was slightly redundant. Having spent a lot of time working on my project at the Department of Public health, I felt that just a presentation or a narrative would be sufficient to relay the work that I had done, not necessarily both. (Ideally a presentation would be preferable as I really enjoyed hearing about my colleagues' projects also).
This is a course where students generally get out of it what they put into it.
This was a great class that allowed to focus channel my passion for the work I do and receive credit for it!

Strength: opportunity to practice public health to benefit the greater community; appreciated the flexibility given the minimal class time 
Weakness: difficult in the 1 semester course to complete anything that was meaningful/substantial; after the final group meeting with individual presentations, I felt disheartened that colleagues often failed to produce a result that was meaningful (beyond personal learning). While students clearly learned about public health, the impact component on local organizations was GROSSLY lacking. Consider a presentation where 5 of the 10 min presentation was spent describing a historical background to tobacco use. Another presentation where an extensive IRB was conducted only to receive 2 responses with minimal generalizability. Perhaps projects already somewhat developed could be advertised to students so that a more meaningful result could be developed.
Diane was excellent, we didn't get much time to interact with her but for the several meetings through the semester I really enjoyed working with her.
Great experience
helpful
Excellent! Good at trouble shooting the various problems with my and other's projects. Very responsive.
She was very supportive, helpful, timely with feedback and seemed to take a true interest in our projects which I really appreciated.
Responsive, extremely helpful with practicum selection, exactly what Yale would want here.
The instructor was amazing! She provided phenomenal feedback and advice throughout the course and was very supportive when issues occurred.

I would have liked the opportunity to have more meetings with my fellow practicum students throughout the semester.  It was interesting to hear what everyone was doing and I think there would have been value in more frequent group check-points.
Great experience
practical, exposes you to real-life scenarios
A great option for those wanting to do their practicum outside of what in house options there are.
I really enjoyed this practicum course as it gave me the opportunity to find an experience that really fit my area of interest. I would recommend it to other students.
Get a head start on signing up for your practicum.

I would highly recommend this course to anyone with a public health related project they would like to pursue. I would recommend establishing the project prior to the start of the semester so you can figure out a timeline to complete it by the end.
